metadata.title: CVE-2024-47540 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: GStreamer is a library for constructing graphs of media-handlingcomponents. An uninitialized stack variable vulnerability has beenidentified in the gst_matroska_demux_add_wvpk_header function withinmatroska-demux.c. When size < 4, the program calls gst_buffer_unmap with anuninitialized map variable. Then, in the gst_memory_unmap function, theprogram will attempt to unmap the buffer using the uninitialized mapvariable, causing a function pointer hijack, as it will jump tomem->allocator->mem_unmap_full or mem->allocator->mem_unmap. Thisvulnerability could allow an attacker to hijack the execution flow,potentially leading to code execution. This vulnerability is fixed in1.24.10.

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-good1.0 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
